data.title: PC Strategy Video Games | 35
data.meta_description: Page 35. Strategy video games for PC sorted by popularity among gamers. Strategy games require an analytical mind, ability think ahead, manage resources, and taking the right tactics in fighting the AI or other players.
data.text:
Zoo Tycoon: Complete Collection

Strategy 05 August 2003

As the title suggests, this is a set of games from the strategic-economic Tycoon Zoo series. It includes the basic game Zoo Tycoon and two official additions to it: Dinosaur Digs and Marine Mania. In addition, in this package you will find the bonus extension Endangered Species Theme Pack.

Demigod

Strategy 14 April 2009

Action game combining RPG and RTS motifs by Gas Powered Games, creators of Dungeon Siege. Entertainment focuses on online struggles, which were modelled on the famous fashion for Warcraft III - DoTA. We have a choice of eight semi-godes, divided into two classes (Assassin or General), which quite significantly differ in fighting style and skills.

John Tiller's Battleground Civil War

Strategy 08 November 2007

John Tiller's Battleground Civil War is a compilation of five programs from the classic Battleground series of classic war games by TalonSoft.

East India Company

Strategy 28 July 2009

Developed by the Finnish studio Nitro Games, the turn-based strategy game combines an extensive economic layer with elements of typical naval strategies. The action of the title takes place in the 18th century and the players become the leader of one of eight nations to lead it to domination on the sea routes of Europe, Africa and South-East Asia. The gameplay itself is two-track.

Alien Nations

Strategy 20 March 1999

Alien Nations is a strategy game set in a fantastic land inhabited by three different nations: brave Amazons, cunning Sajikis and brave Pimmons.

SimCity Societies

Strategy 13 November 2007

SimCity Societies is another part of the best-selling strategic-economic series, developed since the late 1980s. This time, however, the production process did not involve Maxis, but the Tilted Mill Entertainment studio, from which games such as Caesar IV came out. Along with the change of the traditional developer, the concept of fun has been slightly modified.

Wildfire (2004)

Strategy 13 October 2004

Action game in which we play the role of a member of a special firefighting team trying to control the huge forest fires in the United States.

Sudden Strike Forever

Strategy 29 July 2001

Add-on to Sudden Strike real-time strategy game, expanding the standard gameplay capabilities with a number of enhancements that will allow fierce strategy fans to spend a few more days on the fronts of World War II.

The Settlers (1993)

Strategy 22 March 1993

The Settlers is the first installment of an extremely popular series of real-time strategy games that takes us to a medieval kingdom torn apart by war between conflicting barons.

Commander: Europe at War

Strategy 14 June 2007

A turn-based war game set in the realities of World War II. We can direct the Allied forces to repel the march of the Nazi armies or crush enemies to the glory of the Third Reich. The authors offered six great campaigns taking place on all corners of the world. Battle mechanics focuses on tactical depth and historical realism.

American Conquest: Fight Back

Strategy 22 June 2003

Self-contained addition to American Conquest real-time strategy. In extension, we operate from 1517-1804 and carry out 25 extensive missions, divided into eight campaigns. The authors have added several new nations and 50 previously unavailable units to the game. A special feature is a new gameplay mode - single battles.

Against Rome

Strategy 07 November 2003

A real-time strategy with an action set in the early period of our era, i.e. between 200 and 450. We become the leader of one of the primitive barbarian tribes. Together with our people, we invade and plunder enemy settlements. In this way we develop, gain food, weapons and gold, as well as reputation and fame.

Tropico (2001)

Strategy 25 April 2001

Tropico is the first installment of the popular cycle of economic strategies. The player plays the role of a dictator on one of the islands of the fictional archipelago. Its task is to bring a small state to bloom. Developers from PopTop Software studio took care of humorous approach to the subject and climatic visual setting.

Shogun: Total War

Strategy 13 June 2000

An epic strategy game developed by Creative Assembly (a British developer) and taking the player to 16th-century Japan. As the head of a noble family, the player develops their province in order to widen one's area of influence in the country ruined by war. Gameplay was divided into two segments here, combining elements of a turn-based strategy with real-time battles.

Dragon Throne: Battle of Red Cliffs

Strategy 26 March 2002

Real-time strategy with extensive economic elements. The action takes us to the ancient Chinese Empire, when the war divided the country into three principalities - Shu, Wei and Wu. The player plays the role of one of the three principality rulers, and his task is to unite China.

The Settlers III

Strategy 13 October 1998

Third installment of The Settlers series produced and released by Blue Byte Software. The game, although it belongs to the real time strategy (RTS) genre, is characterized by a very complex economic aspect.

Tour of Duty

Strategy 15 September 2000

Tour of Duty is a turn-based strategy in the realities of World War II, prepared by an independent studio Boku Strategy Games. Players play the role of commanders leading to the battle troops composed of various military formations. There are 21 missions to complete in a wide variety of terrain - from Normandy beaches to city streets.

Ski Park Manager

Strategy 20 February 2002

Ski Park Manager is an economic strategy that allows the player to play the role of ski resort manager. Virtual managers must, among other things, take care of the condition of the infrastructure of holiday facilities, build new hotels and catering outlets, set downhill courses and even take care of employee matters. Developers from Lankhor studio took care of intuitively simple interface and nice to the eye visual setting of their work.

Casino Inc.

Strategy 11 April 2003

The economic strategy in which we manage the casino. The action of the game begins in the 70's of the last century, which is the period of the greatest development of casinos, and we have to deal with literally every element of this business.

Codename: Panzers - Phase One

Strategy 14 June 2004

A real-time strategy with a strong focus on tactical elements as well as some elements known from the cRPG, embedded in the realities of World War II.

Victoria: Empire Under the Sun

Strategy 18 November 2003

Another, the fifth part of the well-known series of strategy games Europa Universalis, which takes us back to the period between the nineteenth century and the first decades of the twentieth century. It is a time when many scientific discoveries and advances have been made, and it is also a period of bloody clashes in the First World War.
